question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to provide executable code whenever possible. Help me create a webpage about a secret mailbox.

checklist.title: Is the secret mailbox core functionality fully implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code implements the fundamental secret mailbox features including message encryption, secure storage, and retrieval mechanisms. Score 0 if encryption is missing, 5 if only basic encryption without proper key management is implemented, and 10 if end-to-end encryption with secure key exchange is fully implemented.

checklist.title: Is the user authentication system secure and robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the authentication system uses industry standards (e.g., OAuth, JWT) with proper session management, password hashing (bcrypt/Argon2), and protection against common attacks (CSRF, XSS). Deduct 5 points if password storage is insecure, 3 points if 2FA is missing, and 3 points if there's no account recovery mechanism.

checklist.title: Are privacy and security measures thoroughly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code includes message expiration features, self-destructing messages, encryption at rest, secure transport (HTTPS), and protection against metadata leakage. Deduct 3 points for each missing critical security feature. The implementation should ensure forward secrecy and deniability where appropriate.

checklist.title: Is the message composition and delivery system fully functional?
checklist.description: Review whether the message system allows rich content (text formatting, attachments), scheduled deliveries, read receipts (with privacy options), and recipient verification. Score 3 points for basic messaging, 7 points for comprehensive features, and 10 points for a complete system with error handling and delivery confirmation.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as network interruption, invalid inputs, authentication failures) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Steganography to hide messages within images 2. Decoy messages/mailboxes under duress 3. Location-based or time-based access restrictions). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple encryption methods without clear purpose) 2. Function modules unrelated to secure messaging (e.g., unnecessary social features) 3. Fancy effects that compromise security or performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating security logic/UI/networking layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors, preferably with dark mode for privacy) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance with security-oriented interaction patterns. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
